questions.question: What was the Proclamation Act of 1763?

choices.answer: Denied colonist from migrating west of the Appalachian Mountains
Tax on paper
Colonists could not grow potatoes
Denied colonist from migrating east of the Appalachian Mountains
Tax on ships for trade
Import tax on fish and lumber
Gave the Virginia Company the right to sell tea to the colonies without tax
Gave East India Company the right to sell tea to colonies without taxes

questions.question: What was the Quartering Act of 1765?

choices.answer: Eliminated the quarter from United States currency
British burned all of the colonists houses
British built houses for the colonists
Colonists paid for food and housing for British soldiers

questions.question: What was the Sugar Act of 1764?

choices.answer: A tax on Molasses and Sugar
A tax on Sugar and Tea
A tax on Molasses and Tea
A tax on Tea and Cotton

questions.question: What was the Stamp Act of 1765?

choices.answer: A tax on sugar
A tax on rubber stamps
A tax on colonists houses
A tax requiring paper and documents to have an official stamp

questions.question: Which acts did the British pass as a result of the Boston Tea Party?

choices.answer: The Stamp Act
The Quartering Act
The Intolerable Acts
The Tea Acts

questions.question: What was the Declaratory Act of 1766?

choices.answer: Parliament had the right to tax and rule the colonies
The colonies had to use only British made paper
Parliament could not tax the colonies without their consent
Parliament need the kings approval to rule the colonies

questions.question: What is the Townshend Act of 1767?

choices.answer: Import tax on Sugar and Molasses
Import taxes on paint, glass, lead, paper and tea.
Colonists punished for Boston Massacre
Colonists punished for Boston Tea Party

questions.question: What was a factor of the Intolerable Acts ?

choices.answer: enforced the quartering act
Closed town meetings
closed Boston ports till damages were paid off
all of the above

questions.question: Which harbor did the British close in the Intolerable Acts?

choices.answer: Boston Harbor
Charleston Harbor
New York Harbor
Baltimore Harbor

questions.question: How did the colonist react to the British Acts?

choices.answer: Formed 1st Continential Congress
All of these answers
Protested in the colonies
Boycotted British goods

questions.question: Both the Stamp Act and Townshend Acts were efforts by the British Parliament to...

choices.answer: boost the colonial shipbuilding industry
limit the colonists' use of tea
raise money to pay off debts from the French and Indian War.
reduce colonial smuggling and restrict trade

questions.question: Which act allowed the British to sustain a monopoly on the selling of tea?

choices.answer: The Stamp Act
The Intolerable Acts
The Tea Act
The Sugar Act

questions.question: What did the Townshend Acts tax?

choices.answer: Stamps, Newspapers and Official Documents
Glass, Paper, Paint, Lead And Tea
Sugar and Molasses
Wool, Leather and Cotton

questions.question: What happened during the Boston Massacre?

choices.answer: The killing of 5 colonists by the British soldiers.
When some of the people of Boston dumped tea in the harbor.
The killing of 5 British soldiers within Boston.
A time where everyone went crazy over tacos.

questions.question: What was the verdict of the Boston Massacre Trial?

choices.answer: All the soldiers were convicted and sentenced to death
All the British soldiers were found not guilty
The soldiers were saved by the King
The soldiers never went to trial

questions.question: What caused the Boston Tea party?

choices.answer: The colonist wanted to find a new trade partner
The colonists loved tea
An overproduction of tea
The colonists' anger at the new tea tax

questions.question: What happened during the Boston Tea Party????

choices.answer: Angry colonists threw tea into the Boston Harbor in protest
Native Americans fought for land
Colonists protested outside British courts
Sons of Liberty declared independence from Britain

questions.question: What happened after the Boston Tea Party?

choices.answer: The colonists were executed
George Washington became President
Parliament passed the Intolerable Acts to punish the colonists
Paul Revere created a painting of the event
